Extract as much as possible to classes that can be tested outside of the
application server. The majority of the behaviour you are developing can be
and should be ignorant of wheter it runs in an applicationserver or not. For
system tests there is Cactus and MockEJB. I'm not convinced that it is a
good idea to use those frameworks. I never felt had the need.

I think in those cases deploy your application and run your tests as a
client. Perhaps using FIT or some other acceptance-testing framework. Those
tests are typically run more seldomly than your unit-tests.

This is just my opinion on a way forward. I'm sure those who disagree will
speak up soon :)
